skill.name: researching-with-deepwiki
skill.description:
Research GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket repositories using DeepWiki MCP server. Use when exploring
unfamiliar codebases, understanding project architecture, or asking questions about how a specific
open-source project works. Provides AI-powered repo analysis and RAG-based Q&A about source code.
NOT for fetching library API docs (use fetching-library-docs instead) or local files.
skill.summary:
Research GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket repositories using DeepWiki MCP server. Use when exploring
un...
skill.author: Asmayaseen

security_audit.summary: A pure documentation skill with minimal verification script. The verification script only reads Claude Code settings files to check MCP server configuration - no network calls, no external commands, no sensitive data access. Legitimate purpose aligned with functionality.

content.value_statement: Understanding unfamiliar codebases takes significant time and effort. DeepWiki MCP provides AI-powered repository analysis and RAG-based Q&A for GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket projects.
actual_capabilities: Analyze repository architecture for GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket projects
Explain project structure and directory organization
Investigate how specific features are implemented
Answer questions about source code using RAG-based Q&A
limitations: Public endpoint has usage rate limits
Private repositories require Devin.ai API key
Large repositories may take time to analyze
Cached analysis may not reflect latest commits

use_cases.title: Learn a new framework
use_cases.description: Explore unfamiliar open-source frameworks by asking DeepWiki to explain core concepts and patterns.

use_cases.title: Prepare contributions
use_cases.description: Understand contribution workflows and testing patterns before submitting pull requests.

use_cases.title: Debug integration issues
use_cases.description: Investigate how libraries handle edge cases like connection pooling and error types.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern learning
prompt_templates.prompt: What patterns from github.com/{owner}/{repo} should I follow for my project?

prompt_templates.title: Compare implementations
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare how github.com/{owner}/repo1 and github.com/{owner}/repo2 handle {feature}

output: FastAPI uses a modular architecture with separate modules for routing, dependencies, and middleware
Core components: APIRouter for route definition, Depends for dependency injection, and middleware stack for request processing
Data flow: Request -> Middleware -> Route Handler -> Response

best_practices: Ask specific questions rather than broad queries about a repository
Reference specific paths or directories to focus investigation
Use DeepWiki for external repos only; use Glob/Grep for local files
anti_patterns: Asking vague questions like "Tell me about this repo" without specifics
Using DeepWiki for local code you already have access to
Expecting real-time analysis of very recent commits

faq.question: Which platforms does DeepWiki support?
faq.answer: GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket repositories are supported using standard URL formats.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for the public endpoint?
faq.answer: The public endpoint has usage limits; for higher limits, use the Devin.ai API key option.

faq.question: How do I configure DeepWiki for private repositories?
faq.answer: Add the Devin.ai endpoint with an Authorization header containing your Bearer token in settings.json.

faq.question: Is my code or data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Yes, repository data is analyzed by DeepWiki servers. Do not use with private proprietary code.

faq.question: Why is verification failing?
faq.answer: Ensure MCP server is configured in settings.json with correct URL. Run python3 scripts/verify.py to check.

faq.question: How does this differ from local tools like Glob and Grep?
faq.answer: DeepWiki provides AI-powered analysis for external repos; use local tools for code you already have on disk.
